    VISITOR INFORMATION

    Admission
    Special tickets are not required for this exhibition. Enjoy the exhibition during regular museum hours.


    Members
    Members receive free admission to the museum and to the exhibition. Those needing special assistance should call member services at (312) 629-6587. To become a member or renew your membership, call (312) 575-8000, online, or stop by one of the membership desks inside the museum.


    Audio Tour
    Featuring commentary by Art Institute Curator Larry Feinberg, this MP3 audio guide, produced by Antenna Audio, allows visitors to customize their own route through the exhibition. The cost is $5 for members, $6 for the public. Audio tours are available when purchasing a general-admission ticket.

    Adult Group Tickets
    To make reservations for groups of 15 or more, contact group sales at (312) 443-7494, by fax at (312) 443-7494, or groupsales@artic.edu. Group reservations can be booked with a slide lecture.

    Shop Online
    The Museum Shop offers a selection of unique gifts and holiday delights
    inspired by the exhibition.

    School Groups
    To schedule a student tour, call (312) 443-3679. For more information, click here.

    Location
    The museum is located at 111 S. Michigan Avenue, the intersection of Michigan Avenue and Adams Street, on the eastern edge of Chicago's famous downtown Loop. You can also see check our Web site for parking and transportation information.

    Hotel Information
    Make a weekend of your visit. See a list of hotels that offer Art Institute packages.

    Hours
    Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday: 10:30–4:30
    Tuesday: 10:30–8:00
    Saturday and Sunday: 10:00–5:00
    The museum is closed on Thanksgiving and Christmas days.
    Telephone: (312) 443-3933

    Other Venue
    The Detroit Institute of Arts, March 16–June 8, 2003
